docs.snippet: AXELROD--Jeffrey Alan. May 21, 1959 -February 8, 2015. Jeffrey died peacefully with his family at his side on February 8, 2015. Born in Miami Beach, FL Jeff grew up in Lido Beach, NY and was a longtime resident of New York City and Salisbury, CT. ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
AXELROD--Jeffrey Alan.

May 21, 1959 -February 8, 2015. Jeffrey died peacefully with his family at his side on February 8, 2015. Born in Miami Beach, FL Jeff grew up in Lido Beach, NY and was a longtime resident of New York City and Salisbury, CT. Jeff was a Managing Director at Brean Capital were he routinely mentioned that he worked with the best people in the world. He will always be remembered for his reassuring confidence, love-filled friendships and compassionate spirit. He attended Trinity Pawling School and University of Wisconsin-Madison. Predeceased by his mother Betty (nee Katz) DuPont, stepfather A. DuPont and father Paul B. Axelrod, he is survived by his devoted wife Ellen, loving sister Gale, brother Reed (Annie), nephew Benjamin and many whose lives he touched.

docs.snippet: BECK--Lorraine. UJA-Federation of New York mourns the passing of Lorraine Beck, who leaves behind a loving family who carries on a tradition of exceptional Jewish philanthropy. Our heartfelt condolences go out to Lorraine's children, Susan B. Cham...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BECK--Lorraine.

UJA-Federation of New York mourns the passing of Lorraine Beck, who leaves behind a loving family who carries on a tradition of exceptional Jewish philanthropy. Our heartfelt condolences go out to Lorraine's children, Susan B. Champlin (James) and Stuart (Tulik); her sister, Billie Ross (George); her grandchildren; and the entire family. Alisa R. Doctoroff, President; Linda Mirels, Chair of the Board; Eric S. Goldstein, CEO

headline.main: Samsung Display to Invest $3.6 Billion in New OLED Production Line
headline.print_headline: Samsung Display to Invest $3.6 Billion in New OLED Production Line

docs.snippet: South Korea's Samsung Display plans to invest 4 trillion won ($3.6 billion) into making organic light-emitting diode (OLED) panels as its parent Samsung Electronics Co Ltd looks to boost components sales to offset weaker smartphone earnings....
docs.lead_paragraph: South Korea's Samsung Display plans to invest 4 trillion won ($3.6 billion) into making organic light-emitting diode (OLED) panels as its parent Samsung Electronics Co Ltd looks to boost components sales to offset weaker smartphone earnings.

docs.snippet: SCHEER--Lucille, age 91, loving wife of the late Dr. Alan Scheer, passed away on February 10, 2015. She is survived by her adoring children, Joanne and Robert, beloved grandchildren Joshua, Elizabeth, Rachel and Jeremy, and cherished great-grandch...
docs.lead_paragraph:
SCHEER--Lucille, age 91,

loving wife of the late Dr. Alan Scheer, passed away on February 10, 2015. She is survived by her adoring children, Joanne and Robert, beloved grandchildren Joshua, Elizabeth, Rachel and Jeremy, and cherished great-grandchildren Austin and Lily. She was a grand and elegant woman and will never be forgotten. Funeral to be held at Westchester Reform Temple, Thursday February 12 at 11:30am.

docs.snippet: PARISE--Andrew J., 90, of Cedarhurst, NY, on February 8, 2015. Beloved husband of the late Lillian. Loving father of Andrew Jr. (Deborah), Louise Bencal, and David (Mary Lynn). Cherished grandfather of Kristen (Gordon), Robert (Emily), Jamie (Josh...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARISE--Andrew J., 90, of Cedarhurst, NY, on February 8, 2015. Beloved husband of the late Lillian. Loving father of Andrew Jr. (Deborah), Louise Bencal, and David (Mary Lynn). Cherished grandfather of Kristen (Gordon), Robert (Emily), Jamie (Josh), Erica (Alex), Jessica (Devin), and great grandfather to Courtney, Brooke, Page, Mia and Maddie. Loving Companion of JoMarie. WWII 87th Infantry Battle of the Bulge Veteran. Awarded two Purple Hearts. Mayor of Cedarhurst for the past 20 years. Retired Town of Hempstead Executive Assistant to seven presiding Supervisors and Executive leader of Lawrence-Cedarhurst Republican Party since the early 1960s. Family will receive friends Wednesday and Thursday 2pm-4pm and 7pm-9pm at the Perry Funeral Home Inc., 118 Union Ave., Lynbrook, NY. Funeral Mass Friday 10am at St. Joachims RC Church, Cedarhurst, NY. Interment to follow at Greenfield Cemetery, Hempstead, NY. In lieu of flowers donations in Andrews name can be made to: The Lawrence High School Scholarship Fund; Cedarhurst Memorial Park Fund; Wounded Warriors Fund.

headline.main: Commonwealth Games-Edmonton Drops 2022 Bid; Cites Oil Prices
headline.print_headline: Commonwealth Games-Edmonton Drops 2022 Bid; Cites Oil Prices

docs.snippet: The Canadian city of Edmonton has withdrawn its bid to host the 2022 Commonwealth Games over economic concerns in the wake of a drop in worldwide oil prices, officials said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian city of Edmonton has withdrawn its bid to host the 2022 Commonwealth Games over economic concerns in the wake of a drop in worldwide oil prices, officials said on Tuesday.

docs.snippet: DISPENZIERI--Angelo. Angelo Dispenzieri died peacefully at home in Manhasset, NY surrounded by his family on February 8, 2015 at age 85 after a long struggle with post-polio syndrome. Beloved by his wife of 32 years, Eileen Stegman Dispenzieri, hi...
docs.lead_paragraph:
DISPENZIERI--Angelo.

Angelo Dispenzieri died peacefully at home in Manhasset, NY surrounded by his family on February 8, 2015 at age 85 after a long struggle with post-polio syndrome. Beloved by his wife of 32 years, Eileen Stegman Dispenzieri, his daughters, Elizabeth Mutlu of Bay Terrace, NY and Angela Dispenzieri of Rochester, MN, and his grandsons, Michael Mutlu and James Mutlu. Also survived by his ex-wife Francine Dispenzieri and many nieces and nephews. Born to Sicilian immigrant parents, Cataldo and Sebastiana, on August 2, 1929, he was raised in Williamsburg, Brooklyn with his six siblings: Frank, Josephine Lepani, Anthony, Charles, Angela Pumilia and Salvatore; all of whom preceded him in death. He earned his BA from Baruch College (1953) and his PhD in Psychology from New York University (1961). He lived a full life; a Professor of Psychology at Baruch College where he also served as Dean of Evening and Extension Division; a psychotherapist in private practice; and a consultant/lecturer in industrial/organizational psychology. In his private life, he enjoyed his family, music, fine art, and things of beauty. He lived for love, knowledge and compassion for others, and often said that there is no problem in life that could not be solved. His brand of knowledge, optimism, and story telling was a source of solace, hope and transformation for many. We will miss his presence but he will be with us as he touched us with his love and wisdom. There will be no funeral services at the decedent's request; a private memorial will be held in the spring. Donations in his memory may be made to New York Public Radio, PO Box 1550, New York, NY 10116-1550.

docs.snippet: SKLAR--Rita (Gruber) on February 10, 2015, born August 24th 1924. Daughter of Goldie and Maxwell Gruber. Most devoted wife of the late Leo J. Sklar, M.D. Cherished mother of Susan Lerner; Peter and Joyce Sklar; Patty and Steven Greenstein. Beloved...
docs.lead_paragraph: SKLAR--Rita (Gruber) on February 10, 2015, born August 24th 1924. Daughter of Goldie and Maxwell Gruber. Most devoted wife of the late Leo J. Sklar, M.D. Cherished mother of Susan Lerner; Peter and Joyce Sklar; Patty and Steven Greenstein. Beloved Nana of Caroline and David Perel; Gabrielle and Michael Keown; Keith and Michelle Sklar; Michele and Eric Levin; Matthew Greenstein; Vanessa and Alex Hughes. Adorning Gran-nana of Livia, Ethan and Charlotte Perel; Zoey Sklar; Aden Levin; Lea Greenstein and Bailey Hughes. Sister of Cy Gruber. Donations can be made to the charity of your choice. Services will be held at Boulevard-Riverside Chapel on Wednesday February 11th 2015 at 1pm. Boulevard- Riverside Chapels, 1450 Broadway, Hewlett, NY 11557.
